body: The problem is that the correct defaults for these flags are diametrically opposed: except for a few users with enormous workspaces, everyone will want the default -scope of "everything" so that 'implements' and 'referrers'  just work.  ('referrers' and 'describe' are the commands I use the most.)  But with a --ptascope of "everything", the pointer analysis would never finish, and those users that bother to set a restricted -ptascope would then not be able to use 'referrers' again without changing the scope.
